User provide high-level research directi.Example: "two people bargaining over a mug"; "a judge is setting bail for a criminal defendant who committed 50,000 dollars in tax fraud"
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the social scenario to be simulated and studied by the automated system.

Query Decomposition.Method details: LLM prompts decompose scenario into agents, outcomes, and potential causes.
Query Decomposition.Outputs: List of agents, outcomes, and exogenous variables for SCM construction
Query Decomposition.Example: From 'two people bargaining over a mug', system identifies buyer, seller, outcome (deal), and causes (budget, attachment).
Query Decomposition.Role in workflow: Transforms user scenario into actionable components for hypothesis and experiment design.

Structural or Entity Decomposition.Method details: LLM identifies and constructs agent roles and attributes relevant to the scenario.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Outputs: Agent profiles with roles, goals, constraints, and attributes
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Example: Buyer and seller agents with assigned budgets and attachment levels.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables simulation of social interactions by defining agent-level structure.

Workflow Decomposition.Method details: System formalizes the research process into sequential steps: hypothesis generation, experiment design, execution, and analysis.
Workflow Decomposition.Outputs: Automated multi-step workflow for simulation and analysis
Workflow Decomposition.Example: System autonomously generates hypotheses, designs experiments, runs simulations, and analyzes results.
Workflow Decomposition.Role in workflow: Automates the end-to-end social science research process.

Causal or Relation-Specific Knowledge Gr.Method details: System constructs structural causal models (SCMs) as directed acyclic graphs representing hypothesized causal relationships.
Causal or Relation-Specific Knowledge Gr.Outputs: SCM/DAG encoding variables and causal paths
Causal or Relation-Specific Knowledge Gr.Example: SCM for mug bargaining: buyer budget, seller attachment → deal outcome.
Causal or Relation-Specific Knowledge Gr.Role in workflow: Provides explicit, testable causal structure for experiment design and analysis.

Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Method details: LLM is prompted to generate hypotheses (causal variables and outcomes) based solely on scenario description and internal knowledge.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Outputs: List of hypothesized causes and outcomes for SCM
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Example: For bail hearing, LLM proposes criminal history, judge's case count, and remorse as causes.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Role in workflow: Initiates the automated discovery process by proposing testable hypotheses.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: LLM autonomously generates experimental designs (variables, treatments, agent attributes, interaction protocols) based on SCM.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Outputs: Experimental conditions, agent instantiations, survey questions
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: System selects factorial design for buyer/seller attributes, generates survey questions for outcomes.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Automates the setup of in-silico experiments to test hypotheses.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: System implemented in Python, translates experimental design into executable code for simulation.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Outputs: Python code for agent simulation and data collection
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Python code runs 405 simulations for mug bargaining scenario.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Enables automated, reproducible execution of experiments.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Independent LLM-powered agents are assigned roles (buyer, seller, judge, etc.) and interact according to scenario-specific protocols.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Auction scenario with auctioneer and three bidders, each as an LLM agent.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Realizes social interactions for data generation.

Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Method details: Experiments are executed entirely in-silico using LLM-powered agents simulating human behavior.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Outputs: Simulated behavioral data, conversation transcripts, survey responses
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Role in workflow: Tests hypotheses and generates data for analysis.

Refinement via guided by computational-d.Method details: After experiment, system fits SCM to data, drops insignificant variables, and can propose new variables for follow-on experiments.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Example: Insignificant variables dropped; new causes proposed for next experiment.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Role in workflow: Iteratively improves hypotheses and experimental focus based on computational analysis.
